mods.abstract: Committed to Jail IN the parish of Caddo, a negro man, about 5 feet 7 or 8 inches in height, and about 35 years of age. Calls himself ALLICK.- Also arrested and committed at the same time, a negro woman, about 5 feet 5 or 6 inches in height, and 35 years of age. Calls herself CHARLOTTE. Said negroes say they were sold by a man named Dalton Smith, of Mobile, to Ulyssus Suzette, of Natchez, who has a plantation on the Mississippi, 11 miles below that city. The owner or owners of said negros is hereby notified to come forward, prover property, pay charges, and take them away, or they will be disposed of as the law directs. B. W. DAVIS, Jailor Caddo parish. Shreveport, September 24, 1856
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )
mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
